title: Verstanclahorn
text:
The Verstanclahorn is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> of the Swiss <a href="Silvretta%20Alps">Silvretta Alps</a>, located between <a href="Piz%20Buin">Piz Buin</a> and <a href="Piz%20Linard">Piz Linard</a> in the canton of <a href="Graub%C3%BCnden">Graubünden</a>. The mountain has a pyramidal shape with the northern face lying above the <a href="Verstancla%20Glacier">Verstancla Glacier</a>. The smaller glacier "Vadret da las Maisas" lies on the south side.
The mountain is located on the ridge between the central Graubünden (north) and the <a href="Engadin">Engadin</a>e valley (south), also separating the basins of the <a href="Rhine">Rhine</a> and <a href="Inn%20River">Inn River</a>.
The closest locality is <a href="Lavin">Lavin</a>, on the southern side.
